examples: The book describes her life from cradle to grave.
But the lawyers also described internal politics that at times slowed down the department's work or drove a wedge among members of the team.
And after the match, the Carlisle boss wasn't pulling his punches when describing his players' performance.
BBC is falling over backwards to be impartial by describing this as a crowd!
It was described as a large, luxury mobile home, but there was barely room to swing a cat.
words.defineEn: to give details about someone or something to say what they are like
words.defineVi: để cung cấp thông tin chi tiết về một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó để nói họ như thế nào

examples: Social workers operate on the razor’s edge.
We study the history of our country in social studies class.
You can also get information on careers in social work from their website.
Mark's reputation as a love rat spread quickly among his social circle, as he had a long history of cheating on his partners.
She was always into sports and social activities, while I was your typical bookworm with very few friends.
words.defineEn: related to society and its citizens' lives in general
words.defineVi: liên quan đến xã hội và cuộc sống của công dân nói chung

examples: Our demographics are better than that of other countries.
Even of the continent's demographics are changing.
Experts call it 'the demographic dividend'.
This also changed the country's demographics and the economy.
Maybe the trigeminal nerve is less sensitive in certain demographics.
words.defineEn: *** a particular sector of a population
words.defineVi: *** một khu vực cụ thể của dân số

examples: The magazine keeps tabs on the latest fashion trends.
Gergen had a great sense of news, a good nose for trends, and a wide range of contacts.
The scientist abstracted the data from various sources to analyze trends.
He follows industry blogs and journals to keep up with trends in his profession.
You should avail of the opportunity to attend the conference to network with industry leaders and learn about the latest trends.
words.defineEn: a fashion or style that is popular at a particular time
words.defineVi: một thời trang hoặc phong cách đó là phổ biến tại một thời điểm cụ thể

examples: Statistics show that millions of people are victims of identity theft each year.
Statistics are everywhere.
Statistics are tools.
Statistics are persuasive.
Unsurprisingly, psychologists have noticed these statistics.
words.defineEn: a number or piece of data representing measurements or facts
words.defineVi: một số hoặc một phần dữ liệu đại diện cho các phép đo hoặc sự kiện

examples: The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The bank raised interest rates.
The sector is growing at a phenomenal rate.
Interest rates have been held at 8% for a year now.
Crime rates are soaring and our public transport system is beyond a joke.
words.defineEn: the number of times something changes or happens during a specific period of time
words.defineVi: số lần một cái gì đó thay đổi hoặc xảy ra trong một khoảng thời gian cụ thể

examples: Current drilling technology thus barely scrapes the surface.
The current situation is spelling disaster for the project.
The clock on my computer screen shows the current time and date.
We discuss current scientific advancements and discoveries in science class.
He was happy with his current phone and saw no need to spend money on a new one.
words.defineEn: belonging to or happening at the present time
words.defineVi: thuộc về hoặc xảy ra tại thời điểm hiện tại

examples: Her recent conduct is beyond the pale.
Sales have lost steam in recent weeks.
The company's recent collapse has left their pension fund members up the creek.
The recent strike has put the airline company in a tight spot.
The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
words.defineEn: having happened, started, or been done only a short time ago
words.defineVi: đã xảy ra, bắt đầu, hoặc được thực hiện chỉ một thời gian ngắn trước đây

examples: The lawyer presented the right argument in court.
Bring Helen a present.
Bring a present for Helen.
He presented a false document as evidence in the court case.
Our hosts presented us with an embarrassment of riches.
words.defineEn: the period of time happening now, not before or after
words.defineVi: khoảng thời gian xảy ra bây giờ, không phải trước hay sau
